articles.headline: General Mills and 7-Eleven Join the Venture Capital Crowd
articles.snippet: Through the funds, companies scout for new products or services and business partners, but critics say the funds contribute to inflated valuations.
articles.abstract: Through the funds, companies scout for new products or services and business partners, but critics say the funds contribute to inflated valuations.
articles.lead_paragraph: At first glance, the maker of Cheerios and Cocoa Puffs might not fit the image of a cutting-edge venture capital investor.

articles.headline: Europe Tried to Rein In Google. It Backfired.
articles.snippet: Despite mining people’s data to earn billions of dollars, the search giant has been given the power to police some of the region’s tough privacy rules.
articles.abstract: Despite mining people’s data to earn billions of dollars, the search giant has been given the power to police some of the region’s tough privacy rules.
articles.lead_paragraph: Google is a top target for European regulators and privacy watchdogs, who openly fear and distrust its dominance. The American tech giant’s search engine alone gobbles up roughly 90 percent of the European market.

articles.headline: Ad Agencies Need Young Talent. Cue the Beanbag Chairs.
articles.snippet: To enhance their appeal, agencies are trying to make themselves look less like Madison Avenue and more like start-ups and tech companies.
articles.abstract: To enhance their appeal, agencies are trying to make themselves look less like Madison Avenue and more like start-ups and tech companies.
articles.lead_paragraph: At the headquarters of the McCann agency in Manhattan, the battle for the future of the advertising industry is being waged with piped-in electronic music and employee-brewed beer.

articles.headline: Theranos Under Federal Criminal Investigation, Adding to Its Woes
articles.snippet: In a note to outside partners, the company said that the Justice Department had requested documents and that the investigation was active.
articles.abstract: In a note to outside partners, the company said that the Justice Department had requested documents and that the investigation was active.
articles.lead_paragraph: Theranos, the embattled blood-testing laboratory, said on Monday that federal officials were conducting a criminal investigation into the company, adding to a series of questions from officials about its inner workings.
articles.byline: By Reed Abelson and Andrew Pollack

articles.headline: Obama to Visit a Saudi Arabia Deep in Turmoil
articles.snippet: As the kingdom prepares to greet the president, it faces low oil prices, rising Iranian influence and fears of a widening rift with the United States.
articles.abstract: As the kingdom prepares to greet the president, it faces low oil prices, rising Iranian influence and fears of a widening rift with the United States.
articles.lead_paragraph: RIYADH, Saudi Arabia — The images of the past year have been deeply unsettling for the people of Saudi Arabia, long accustomed to oil-fueled prosperity and regional clout: militants firing at communities along the country’s southern border; protesters storming the Saudi Embassy in Tehran; civil wars raging in three nearby states.
articles.byline: By Ben Hubbard and Nicholas Kulish

articles.headline: Potential G.O.P. Convention Fight Puts Older Hands in Sudden Demand
articles.snippet: Delegate courting that may require more smarts than smartphones is upending the idea of politics as a young person’s game, with many veterans of the 1976 battle returning.
articles.abstract: Delegate courting that may require more smarts than smartphones is upending the idea of politics as a young person’s game, with many veterans of the 1976 battle returning.
articles.lead_paragraph: The last time Stuart Spencer courted delegates at a Republican National Convention, in 1976, he kept a roll of quarters in his pocket for when he had to run to the pay phones and call in reports to President Gerald R. Ford’s campaign headquarters.

articles.headline: Vehicle in Convoy of U.S. Ambassador to U.N. Kills Boy in Cameroon
articles.snippet: Samantha Power later visited the family of the 7-year-old who was killed after he rushed to see the motorcade hurtling through his village.
articles.abstract: Samantha Power later visited the family of the 7-year-old who was killed after he rushed to see the motorcade hurtling through his village.
articles.lead_paragraph: MOKOLO, Cameroon — As the convoy barreled through a village in northern Cameroon on Monday, a 7-year-old boy darted to the road, excited to see the chain of white S.U.V.s carrying Samantha Power, the first cabinet-level American official to visit the country since 1991.

articles.headline: Recruiting Students Overseas to Fill Seats, Not to Meet Standards
articles.snippet: Several companies are using high-pressure tactics, critics say, to persuade international students to enroll in U.S. colleges. Many will need remedial help to succeed.
articles.abstract: Several companies are using high-pressure tactics, critics say, to persuade international students to enroll in U.S. colleges. Many will need remedial help to succeed.
articles.lead_paragraph: BOWLING GREEN, Ky. — “Hurry Up!!!” the online posting said. “Spot Admissions” to Western Kentucky University. Scholarships of up to $17,000 were available, it added. “Letter in one day.” The offer, by a college recruiter based in India, was part of a campaign so enticing that more than 300 students swiftly applied to a college that many had probably never heard of.

articles.headline: Liberal Biases, Too, May Block Progress on Climate Change
articles.snippet: Liberal resistance to nuclear power plants, which emit virtually no greenhouse gases, could be damaging in the effort to combat climate change.
articles.abstract: Liberal resistance to nuclear power plants, which emit virtually no greenhouse gases, could be damaging in the effort to combat climate change.
articles.lead_paragraph: Are liberals impairing our ability to combat climate change?

articles.headline: After a Rough Quarter, Goldman Faces Questions on Strategy
articles.snippet: Wall Street banks have been buffeted by tumultuous financial markets, but Goldman Sachs had particularly weak results because of its focus on trading.
articles.abstract: Wall Street banks have been buffeted by tumultuous financial markets, but Goldman Sachs had particularly weak results because of its focus on trading.
articles.lead_paragraph: Goldman Sachs has been betting that it will again see around the next corner better than its competitors.

articles.headline: Volkswagen Case Gives Judge, Onetime Aspiring Actor, Role of a Lifetime
articles.snippet: The overseeing of the class-action suits brought by American car owners is a career highlight for Charles R. Breyer, who is widely described as fair, pragmatic and creative.
articles.abstract: The overseeing of the class-action suits brought by American car owners is a career highlight for Charles R. Breyer, who is widely described as fair, pragmatic and creative.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — As Volkswagen faced a court-mandated deadline to reach an agreement with regulators on a plan to fix its polluting diesel cars last month, one lawyer for the German automaker mentioned that he had probably never worked harder in his career.
